Description: Rim and body sherd of North Ionian pottery eye-cup; interior: glazed with band of thin purple framed by white stripes; exterior: large eye with arching eyebrow and a spiral form to denote the nose; thin horizontal line below the handle zone; top of rim on the exterior glazed. Drill hole from sampling for clay analysis in lower edge of sherd.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For the results of the clay analysis, see R. Jones, Greek and Cypriot Pottery: A Review of Scientific Studies, (Athens 1986), p. 664, no. 31 and p. 701, table 8.18, no. 31 (G116.6).
Bibliographic references: Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 256, no. 2)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (II D, pl. I, no. 16)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.461)
Jones 1986 / Greek and Cypriot Pottery: a Review of Scientific Studies (p.701, table 8.18, no.31)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
